title: Web3 AI Registry
description: Decentralized discovery platform for AI agents using custom MCP servers and .agt domains on Polygon blockchain
subtitle: Building a Decentralized MCP Server Discovery Platform
initial_vision_h1: Bridging Web3 Domains with AI Agent Discovery
problem_statement_h2: The Challenge of AI Agent Discovery
problem_body: The rapid proliferation of AI agents and MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers created a critical discovery problem. **How do users find and connect with specialized AI services?** Traditional centralized registries pose risks of censorship, single points of failure, and lack of transparency.\n\nI set out to create a decentralized solution that would leverage Web3 domains (.agt) as unique identifiers for AI agents, enabling a trustless, permissionless marketplace for AI services on the Polygon blockchain.
approach_list: Architected smart contracts for on-chain agent registration;Implemented WebSocket validation for MCP endpoint verification;Built capability-based discovery and search functionality;Created Web3 wallet integration with RainbowKit;Developed real-time blockchain data synchronization;Designed intuitive UI for non-technical users to register agents
architecture_body: The platform consists of **three core components** working in harmony: 1. *Smart Contract Layer* • ERC-721 domain ownership verification • On-chain agent metadata storage • Capability tagging system • Active status tracking 2. *Frontend Application* • Next.js 14 with TypeScript • Real-time blockchain queries • WebSocket connection testing • Search and filter interface 3. *MCP Integration* • JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol support • WebSocket endpoint validation • Capability standardization • Agent chain linking
innovation_body:
Several key innovations emerged from this project:

**1. Domain-Based Registration**
• Human-readable .agt domains instead of token IDs
• *Innovation:* Reverse lookup system for NFT metadata
• *Result:* Intuitive user experience for Web3 newcomers

**2. Live Endpoint Validation**
• Pre-registration WebSocket testing
• *Process:* Automated handshake verification
• *Benefit:* Ensures only working agents are registered

**3. Composable Agent Chains**
• Agents can reference other agents
• *Architecture:* Graph-based discovery network
• *Impact:* Enable complex AI workflows through composition
collaboration_body: This project represents the convergence of two transformative technologies: 1. **Blockchain Benefits** Ownership: Agents tied to verifiable domain ownership Transparency: All registrations publicly auditable Censorship Resistance: No central authority can remove agents 2. **AI Accessibility** Discovery: Find specialized AI services by capability Interoperability: Standard MCP protocol for all agents Composability: Build complex workflows from simple agents 3. **Developer Experience** Templates: Ready-to-deploy MCP server examples Validation: Built-in testing before blockchain transactions Documentation: Comprehensive guides for agent builders The platform bridges the gap between Web3 infrastructure and practical AI applications.
results_list: Successfully deployed on Polygon Amoy testnet with verified contracts;Registered multiple live AI agents including Keyword Scout and Test Agent;Created reusable MCP server templates for rapid agent development;Established capability taxonomy for AI service discovery;Built working proof-of-concept for decentralized AI marketplace;Open-sourced entire codebase for community development
